column3: ThreadFlushWalletDB is started from init still, no?\n

@luke-jr yes but that doesn't use CWalletDB and handles something having the database open already just fine.

The goal here is to cache the CWalletDB across nested CWallet calls to avoid performance issues. (Similar to what the initial wallet encryption logic does).
Would be kind of nice to not expose DBErrors further from wallet, though I would still call this a strict improvement.\n
Does this lose atomicity? Could duplicate the function to add a wrapper which does not require the walletdb pointer?\n
DBErrors is already exposed in CWallet::LoadWallet I'll probably change that later\n
I've made AccountMove atomic again by overloading AddAccountingEntry\n

Maybe, I'm going to go through all of the API calls and make things which can be private private as a sweep.

I'd rather fix this then.
